column4: Does anyone know of a way to keep windows from being on more than one viewport at a time if dragged offscreen?
is there a way in compiz config?
do you have proprietary drivers or what? if you do, go to the add hardware program and check (it says there)
it's under System->Add Hardware (or something similar)
in 11.04 just open up dash and search hardware
or not... drivers maybe? type "drivers" in the dash
under additional drivers it says I'm not using proprietary drivers
then i can't help (sorry). I guess you can play around with compiz config
if you don't have compiz config already, do "sudo apt-get install compizconfig-settings-manager" in the commandline
do you want a window to span multpile or no?

I do not. Sometimes I'll drag a window around and it will accidentally be on another workspace so when I switch to the new workspace there will be like a tenth of a window hanging over on the screen and I'll have to change back to the other workspace and resize it. It's annoying.
look somewhere in "window management" in ccsm
what's the difference between put and viewport switcher?
I mean the 'put' category in window management and 'viewport switcher' in desktop
lemme see... not an expert (or even close to) in compiz, but I can see
I think switcher is the actual SWITCHING vs. place is putting it in a certain spot
